The public address where the user registration originated.  The address is captured from the Via header in the latest REGISTER request received.
The public port where the user registration originated.  The port is captured from the Via header in the latest REGISTER request received.

The private address where the user registration originated, such as when the user device is situated behind a firewall. The address is captured from the Via header in the latest REGISTER request received.
The private port where the user registration originated, such as when the user device is situated behind a firewall. The port is captured from the Via header in the latest REGISTER request received.

<!-- This file defines the schema types and elements required by the          -->
<!-- Call Forwarding Always User Service interface in the                     -->
Contains the Call Forwarding Always service configuration data.
Call Forwarding Always allows you to forward all your incoming calls to a different
phone number or SIP-URI, such as your home office or cell phone. You can also
make your primary phone emit a short ring burst to inform you if you are next to your
phone when the call is forwarded by using the Ring Reminder. This is important
when you have forgotten the service is turned on and you are at your primary
receive calls. Note that the address (phone number or SIP-URI) you forward
your calls to must be permitted by your outgoing calling plan. You can also
number or SIP-URI to forward to using the voice portal or on the phone
When set to true, indicates that the subscriber should
be notified through a ring tone that a call has been forwarded.

Contains the Call Forwarding No Answer service configuration data.

incoming calls to a different phone number or SIP-URI if your phone is
service when you would rather have a secretary or co-worker receive the
caller being sent to your voice messaging box. Note that the address
you forward your calls to must be permitted by your outgoing calling
plan. You can also set the
phone number or SIP-URI to forward to using the feature access code.
